Discount pricing of $200 off ends July 5th for Vidare Creative’s Fundraising 24 conference taking place July 17th-18th in Nashville.

Fundraising 24 speaker line-up this year includes:

Beth Bacall – Fundraising: A behind the board perspective, John Frost – Creating Radio that Transforms, Chuck Finney – Stories > Stats, Sterling Tarrant – Developing Your Engagement 365 – Messaging through Produced Content, Joe Paulo – Ministry Leaders: How to fail at fundraising in 5 easy steps, Tim Smith – Major Donors: Building authentic relationships, Jared Mitchell – Between the Asks: Managing the Relationship of a Mid-Level Donor, Matt Mundt – How and Why Digital Ads Boost Your Support Drive

Devotions on Day 2 will led by Helen Smallbone. Evening music from Fair Trade and Red Street Records Wednesday night, and Centricity on Thursday.

Register HERE now.

The Prayz Network/Sparta, WI is giving away tickets to “:Praise in the Pines” a new Christian music festival to be held July 21st in Eagle River, WI. Te line-up includes Big Daddy Weave, Austin French, Hannah Kerr and guest speaker Bob Lenz.

Also The Prayz Network has launched it’s latest frequency at 100.9 in Tomahawk, WI.

KSWP/KAVX/Lufkin hosted its annual luncheon for the Church and Community Emergency Response Team (CCERT) to renew connections and welcome new members ahead of the storm season.

“The primary purpose of this team is to be the hub of reliable communication — to the radio station and to each other so that our community can receive timely important information,” general manager Michelle Ross said. “As a voice to 13 counties across East Texas, it’s our honor to serve together.”

The CCERT Team formed in 2021 with almost 50 church and organizational leaders in Nacogdoches, Cherokee and Angelina counties committed to staying connected in the event the area faced a major weather event or community-wide emergency.

If interested go HERE.

Southern Gospel Justified Quartet welcomes two new members to the group Anthony Patton and Tony Goforth joining founding members, Tim Caldwell and Mark Jacoby.

Anthony Patton’s love of singing Gospel music comes from a legacy of music ministers and preachers in his family while Anthony has sung with his family, local quartets, and most recently with the trio, Three Nails.

Anthony who will sing lead with Justified Quartet says, “I’m excited and looking forward to this journey with Justified Quartet,” states Patton. Anthony and his wife, Melissa, reside in Decatur, TN.

The July CMB Webinar is July 10th at 12 noon CT. Amy Woods, CEO and Founder of Content 10x, shares how to serve listeners better while you stay in the creative flow that already makes your station great. Zoom Webinar ID – 894 8547 0185.

WSIZ/Jacksonville GA (102.3) & WVXY/Axson (97.1) including translators 98.1 W251AU Ocilla and 99.9 W260BU Douglas is being purchased by Journey Church of Tifton for $175,000.

KFRS/Soledad CA (89.9) and translators K213BZ Richvale (90.5) and W207AX Burlington VT (89.3) are being acquired by CSN International from Family Stations for $80,000.

The FCC denied a request by WEKC/Williamsburg, KY (AM 710) to reinstate its license and resume broadcast operations. The station is currently silent

HisAir NEWS FLASHBACK – July 3, 2023 -KHBW/International Falls, MN (Heartland Christian Broadcasters) PD/morning host Michele Eastty has been promoted to General Manager. Longtime GM Bruce Christopherson, is retiring after 40 years service.
